page.title: 07Local History.
page.content: {The Battle of Roundway Down (1643) { { }During the English Civil War the town of Devizes was put under siege by General Waller and his Roundhead Army. They were stationed on top of Roundway Hill. This gave them an elevated position from which to bombard the town. Cannonball has been found in the roof of St.James church near the Crammer. The Royalist troops counter attacked the Parliamentarian troops, durring the night. The Roundheads were driven down the side of the hill, towards the covert and slaughtered in the drainage ditches below. The ditch is still known as the "Bloody Ditch" today.
